addressleaf.section:
To
e right honorable my very singular good Lord, the L. Burghley, Lord highe Treasurer of England.

31 Au
g
1591 M
r
Bodley from Haghe.
The returne of the
states
Captains from viewing
Hulst
in
Zeland

page.lettertext:
fol.351r
It may please yo
r
good L. to be adver-
tised, that assoone as I had sealed my other
letters right nowe, those Captaines returned
whome
Count Maurice
had imploied to en-
quire about Hulst. By that w
ch
they
report,
e Enterprise, we hope, wilbe happely
atchieved. For they doe seeme to assure us
that there is in
e towne but one Enseigne
of men, and only two Advenues for the
Enemie to succo
r
it: w
ch
w
t
all they affirme
may be easely possessed and defended by us.
It is thought
e exploit may be perfourmed
w
t
4000 men, w
ch
are sent for already
from
e neerest garrisons.
And this I
thought to signifie,
e opportunitie being
offered, w
t
my former to yo
r
L. and
so I take my humble leave. At
e Hage
Au
g
31 1591.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
